vote.title: To authorize the City Attorney to execute a property damage release and accept a payment of $69,155.00 on behalf of the Department of Public Utilities to settle a property damage claim; to authorize the City Auditor to deposit the funds into the Land Stewardship Fund
vote.description:
Explanation
 
This Ordinance is submitted to authorize the acceptance of a payment and execution of a liability release to resolve a property damage claim for damage to property adjacent to 9063 Oakwood Point.  The damaged property is owned by the city and managed by the Department of Public Utilities (“DPU”).  DPU assessed damage due to tree removal and trimming in an amount of $69,155.00.  The adjacent property owner, Margina Romine's insurance company, Liberty Mutual Insurance, has agreed to pay this amount to resolve the claim.  This legislation authorizes the City Attorney to execute a property damage release and accept payment of $69,155.00 on behalf of DPU.  This legislation further authorizes the City Auditor to deposit the funds into the Land Stewardship Fund in accordance with Section 1117.06 of the Columbus City Codes.
 
Title
 
To authorize the City Attorney to execute a property damage release and accept a payment of $69,155.00 on behalf of the Department of Public Utilities to settle a property damage claim; to authorize the City Auditor to deposit the funds into the Land Stewardship Fund
 
Body
 
WHEREAS, the Department of Public Utilities assessed damage to city-owned property adjacent to 9063 Oakwood Point in an amount of $69,155.00; and 
WHEREAS, the adjacent property owner’s insurance company, Liberty Mutual Insurance has agreed to pay this amount to resolve the claim; and 
WHEREAS, it is necessary to authorize the City Attorney to execute a property damage release and accept payment of $69,155.00 on behalf of the Department of Public Utilities to resolve this claim; and 
WHEREAS, it is necessary to authorize the City Auditor to deposit the funds into the Land Stewardship Fund in accordance with Section 1117.06 of the Columbus City Codes; and NOW, THEREFORE
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS: 
SECTION 1. That the City Attorney is authorized to execute a property damage release and accept payment of $69,155.00 to resolve a claim for damage to city-owned property.  
SECTION 2. That the City Auditor is authorized to deposit the funds into the Land Stewardship Fund in accordance with Section 1106.06 of the Columbus City Codes. 
SECTION 3. That this ordinance shall take effect and be in force from and after the earliest period allowed by law.
